availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Calvin C. Burt (New York, New York, attorney.)

body.p: New York City, New York County, New York attorney and commissioner of deeds. New York City, New York County, New York native. Son of David Burt and Jemima Wells Burt. Father of Maria Burt, Mary Burt, and William Burt. Married to Jenny Burt. Attorney in St. Louis, St. Louis County, Missouri, in 1860. Employed Kate Morran as a domestic servant in St. Louis, St. Louis County, Missouri, in 1860. Commissioner of Deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in New York in 1861. Attorney in Buffalo, Erie County, New York, in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Louis County, 3rd Ward St. Louis City, p. 115.
Census of the State of New York (1865), Population Schedules, New York, Erie County, Buffalo, p. 36-7.
KYR-0001-017-0236.
Michigan Death Records, 1897-1920, Michigan Department of Community Health, DVRHS, Lansing, MI, File #718..
"Passing of Calvin C. Burt," The Detroit Free Press (Detroit, Michigan), February 20, 1902.
